# Avatar (Movie) — Microdata + RDFa (and JSON-LD)

<[item\:Movie](item:Movie)>\[

# <<name>>\[Avatar]

**Director:** <\<item\:Person prop=director>>\[
<<name>>\[James Cameron] (born <<birthDate>>\[1954-08-16])
]

**Genre:** <<genre>>\[Science fiction]

]

## Mixed vocab example (Dublin Core)

<\<item\:dc\:CreativeWork vocab=[http://purl.org/dc/terms/>>\[](http://purl.org/dc/terms/>>[)
<[dc\:title](dc:title)>\[Avatar — review]
<[dc\:creator](dc:creator)>\[Fan Reviewer]
]

---

## Notes

* Use ISO dates inside date properties (e.g., `<<birthDate>>[1954-08-16]`).
* Place the `<<item:TYPE>>[` opener alone on a line to wrap multiple blocks; close with a lone `]` on its own line.
* For URL-valued properties like `trailer`, `url`, `sameAs`, or `image`, consider enabling the optional "hoist-to-link" behavior in the filter so the attribute is applied directly to the `<a>`/`<img>` element.
